gov.nih.nci.ncia.queryhandler
Interface IQueryHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
ContentTypeQueryHandler, DataBasketAnnotationsQueryHandler, DataBasketQueryHandler, DICOMPatientQueryHandler, DICOMQueryHandler, DICOMSeriesQueryHandler, LatestCurationDateQueryHandler, QuarantinedFileQueryHandler, QueryHandlerProxy, VerifySubmissionQueryHandler
public interface IQueryHandler

It appears that a query handler is an object that takes a "query object" and turns it into HQL to go to the database. A query object appears to be a collection of criteria objects that describe what to retrieve.

Not sure why this parameter is a java.lang.Object instead of gov.nih.nci.ncia.query.Query?

Method Summary
 java.util.List<ResultSet> hqlProcess(java.lang.Object query)
          For the given query object, turn it into HQL and send it to the data access layer for processing.
 

Method Detail

hqlProcess

java.util.List<ResultSet> hqlProcess(java.lang.Object query)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
For the given query object, turn it into HQL and send it to the data access layer for processing.

A ResultSet is just a marker interface, so in reality, just about anything could come back from this invocation depending on the concrete impl for the query handler.

Not sure why an _ordered_ list of these ResultSet things come back either? The series query returns a list of image result sets which sort of makes sense.... but why not just return one result set that allows access to the list of image result sets? The top level series result set might contain useful info too? Don't know.....?

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
